Articles.Content:
On 6/25/2021 at 8:17 PM, Kronus_Aerospace said:

Texture size doesn't have any impact on performance unless it exceeds your cards VRAM capacity. Seeing as the 1080 ti has a hefty 11 GB this isn't a concern for that card. The 3080 ti has 12 GB so equally not a concern. KSP's performance is highly CPU dependent when talking about large and complex craft, however AVP and it's dependencies primarily affect the GPU.

Thanks for the info! Much appreciated!

On 6/25/2021 at 9:34 PM, Kerbal Productions said:

Is AVP ready for 1.12 or not? Just asking.

It's good to go. Knock yourselves out!
Scuttlebutt says there's some unity performance improvements in 1.12. Thinking about upgrading because of it. Anyone using AVP on 1.12 notice anything?
Yeah I just reinstalled the newest everything and it's definitely way smoother, didn't check fps but was really noticeable. Thank you!

So I'm having a bit of trouble getting the pack to work correctly.  Most of the features are working but the skybox is not.  I can see it on the main screen but when I go into the game I am stuck with the default one.  I've tried reinstalling the mod several times and used CKAN to make sure it is correct.  From what I found searching it may also be possible to use texture replace to replace the vanalla skybox with the AVP one but I don't know how to do that.  Here is my mod list below.

Airplane Plus (AirplanePlus 26.5)
Astronomer's Visual Pack (AstronomersVisualPack 3:v4.11)
Astronomer's Visual Pack-4k Textures (AVP-4kTextures v1.12)
AT Utils (AT-Utils v1.9.6)
B9 Part Switch (B9PartSwitch v2.18.0)
BetterTimeWarpContinued (BetterTimeWarpCont 2.3.12.8)
Breaking Ground (BreakingGround-DLC 1.7.0)
Chatterer (Chatterer 0.9.99)

I noticed that in my game, the cloud layer abruptly ends at 10,000 meters altitude. It looks weird on rocket takeoff or re-entry.
Does it work that way or could it be some bug or misconfiguration in my game?

I'm using the latest version of this mod as well as EVE and Scatterer (maximum settings)!

* I removed the CityLights files from this mod directory!

** KSP 1.12.1 Windows x64

Thanks

Ok I fixed it, I had galaxies unbound installed as well and they GU_Skybox was overwriting the AP_skybox.  *facepalm*

On 1/15/2020 at 10:28 PM, PanjshirLion said:

This is how my game looks with only the required mods installed. Once I actually load into a game, Kerbin looks normal and less rainbowy, but the extremely busy, "fuzzy" skybox is still there:



Is this how AVP is supposed to look out of the box or am I missing something?

Delete the AVP_Skybox folder from the AVP mod folder

(Deleted post)

Edited September 20, 2021 by SpaceX_Boi

13 minutes ago, SpaceX_Boi said:

I'm running on 1.11.2, and the latest version of the mod should be compatible, but CKAN doesn't think so.  

It works fine in 1.11.2

Add 1.12 as a compatible version in CKAN or manually install it.

On 7/10/2021 at 1:56 AM, Dominiquini said:

I noticed that in my game, the cloud layer abruptly ends at 10,000 meters altitude. It looks weird on rocket takeoff or re-entry.
Does it work that way or could it be some bug or misconfiguration in my game?

I'm using the latest version of this mod as well as EVE and Scatterer (maximum settings)!

* I'm using de 8k pack

* I removed the CityLights files from this mod directory!

** KSP 1.12.1 Windows x64

Thanks

Is anyone else having this problem?

Note that these two screenshots are only a few meters apart, and in one image the volumetric clouds appear and in the other they are gone!

Video: https://www.dropbox.com/s/qsmdbx7l3b95jba/KSP Launch.mp4?dl=0

Thanks.

On 7/14/2021 at 7:04 PM, Dominiquini said:

Is anyone else having this problem?

Note that these two screenshots are only a few meters apart, and in one image the volumetric clouds appear and in the other they are gone!

Video: https://www.dropbox.com/s/qsmdbx7l3b95jba/KSP Launch.mp4?dl=0

Thanks.

 

* I tested the volumetric clouds using the EVE default config (BoulderCo) and it looks like volumetric clouds are working fine!

Thanks.

Hmm, is this mod supposed to remove Jool's rings? Anyone manage to get the Jool rings working? The OP doesn't say this mod is supposed to remove them, yet my game doesn't have them and neither do any of the other screenshots I've seen on this topic, yet the screenshots of Jool in the AVP loading screens clearly have rings, so I'm confused. This question  has been asked a few times in this thread, but we haven't gotten an official answer yet. Is this a bug?

On 7/14/2021 at 3:04 PM, Dominiquini said:

Is anyone else having this problem?

Yes, I see that as well.  The volumetric clouds appear (around 2500m) and disappear (around 10000m) abruptly.  I found this so immersion-breaking I stopped using AVP.  (But did re-install with CKAN to test with 1.12.1.)  I'm on Linux, not other visual mods installed.

Hello

May I know how to enable the effects of twilight zone?

kerbin

Hello!

Does anyone know whether an RTX 3060 laptop GPU is capable of running the 43k Kerbin clouds without serious amounts of lag? 

And as for the installation process, do we just have to drop AVP, the textures, and the dependencies into GameData or are there additional instructions that needs to be followed?

Thanks!

On 7/19/2021 at 9:46 PM, Zeggpold said:

Yes, I see that as well.  The volumetric clouds appear (around 2500m) and disappear (around 10000m) abruptly.  I found this so immersion-breaking I stopped using AVP.  (But did re-install with CKAN to test with 1.12.1.)  I'm on Linux, not other visual mods installed.

I'm trying to find out if this is my own problem or is it a bug in this mod!

Thanks.

Cloud popup problem is just a bad EVE config

in CloudsManager switch to AVP/*/*/Clouds

MainClouds:

increase area and visibleRange to something like 20k

Optionaly enable Volumetrics on CirrusClouds too

I also enabled shadowMaterial for the sweet groundshadows (reduce speed to ~0.1 if u do this)

can't say anything about fps impact im running on 3080...

On 7/25/2021 at 1:50 AM, Sukha said:

Cloud popup problem is just a bad EVE config

in CloudsManager switch to AVP/*/*/Clouds

MainClouds:

increase area and visibleRange to something like 20k

Optionaly enable Volumetrics on CirrusClouds too

I also enabled shadowMaterial for the sweet groundshadows (reduce speed to ~0.1 if u do this)

can't say anything about fps impact im running on 3080...

Could you send your config files?  I tried making the change you suggested on MainClouds and my volumetric clouds disappeared entirely.  And when I tried turning on Volumetrics on the CirrusClouds, the whole world turned into a cloud...
Hello guys !, Awesome mod over here, still I would like to increase the amount of clouds visible and their thickness, any suggestion ?

Am I the only one that has a problem? On 1.12.1 installing AVP with textures and every single dependency there is, there is no orange band or twilight as shown in the images, it seems to load properly but isn't working completely.

 

Log because i dont know how to put files or images:

 

[LOG 13:57:50.532] ******* Log Initiated for Kerbal Space Program - 1.12.1.3142 (LinuxPlayer) en-us *******
Kerbal Space Program - 1.12.1.3142 (LinuxPlayer) en-us

[Snip]

Edited August 26, 2021 by James Kerman
Removed full log

Welcome to the forum @gameskipper, your post has been edited because very large posts like log files cause page loading problems for the forum and make threads difficult to navigate on mobile devices. Please us a hosting service like google drive or dropbox to upload your log file to and then link to it here.

Had some weird flickering issue going on with AVP and Parallax. It's a problem with city lights and parallax. Any insight to how this can be fixed?

Comment about compatibility in Parallax thread
Is there a way to get the city lights to work with parallax like with SVE?

Hey there!

I know this probably isn't the best place for this question but I only get this issue with Astronomer's.

Using reflections with TextureReplacer, only a portion of the clouds show up.

I'm not sure how reflections work in KSP, or how they interact with the game.

Is there some atmospheric FOV setting that the shader involved in cloud rendering uses in Astronomer's maybe? Limiting reflection FOV render range for performance?

Maybe these reflections for Astronomer's are just loaded through Scatterer and the problem might actually lie with some setting in there?

Any ideas at all would be really appreciated while I try to figure out a fix.

Thanks so much!
